storyTitle: As Compliance Officer, I want to monitor data access logs to achieve regulatory compliance

functional.title: Verify Compliance Officer can successfully view all data access logs without filters
preconditions: User is logged in as Compliance Officer with valid credentials
Access logs database contains at least 50 log entries from the past 30 days
User has 'View Access Logs' permission enabled
Browser is Chrome version 90 or higher

steps.action: Navigate to the main dashboard and click on 'Data Access Logs' menu item in the left navigation panel
steps.expectedResult: Data Access Logs page loads successfully within 3 seconds, displaying the log table with columns: Timestamp, User ID, Action Type, Resource Accessed, IP Address, Status

steps.action: Observe the default view of access logs without applying any filters
steps.expectedResult: System displays logs in descending chronological order (newest first), showing 25 entries per page with pagination controls at the bottom

steps.action: Verify each log entry contains complete information in all columns
steps.expectedResult: All log entries display complete data: valid timestamps in 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS' format, user identifiers, action types (READ/WRITE/DELETE/UPDATE), resource names, IP addresses in valid format, and status indicators (Success/Failed)

steps.action: Click on the 'Next Page' button in pagination controls
steps.expectedResult: Next 25 log entries load within 3 seconds, page counter updates to show 'Page 2 of X', and scroll position returns to top of table

steps.action: Verify the page load time indicator or browser network tab
steps.expectedResult: Log retrieval and display completes within 3 seconds as indicated by performance metrics or network timing

postconditions: User remains on Data Access Logs page with logs displayed
No errors are logged in browser console or application error logs
Session remains active and user is still authenticated
Database connection is properly closed after query execution

functional.title: Verify Compliance Officer can filter access logs by date range and retrieve results within performance requirements
preconditions: User is logged in as Compliance Officer
User is on the Data Access Logs page
Access logs database contains entries spanning at least 90 days
Date range filter controls are visible and enabled

steps.action: Click on the 'Start Date' calendar input field in the filter panel at the top of the page
steps.expectedResult: Calendar picker opens displaying current month with selectable dates, today's date is highlighted

steps.action: Select a start date 30 days in the past from today's date
steps.expectedResult: Selected date appears in 'Start Date' field in format 'MM/DD/YYYY', calendar picker closes automatically

steps.action: Click on the 'End Date' calendar input field
steps.expectedResult: Calendar picker opens with dates before the start date disabled/grayed out

steps.action: Select today's date as the end date
steps.expectedResult: Selected date appears in 'End Date' field, calendar picker closes

steps.action: Click the 'Apply Filters' button with blue background in the filter panel
steps.expectedResult: Loading spinner appears, system retrieves filtered logs within 3 seconds, table updates to show only logs within the selected date range, result count displays 'Showing X results for selected date range'

steps.action: Verify the first and last log entries in the filtered results
steps.expectedResult: All displayed log entries have timestamps within the selected date range (between start date 00:00:00 and end date 23:59:59)

postconditions: Filtered logs are displayed matching the selected date range criteria
Filter selections remain visible in the filter panel for reference
Performance metric confirms retrieval completed within 3 seconds
User can clear filters or apply additional filters without page reload

functional.title: Verify Compliance Officer can filter logs by user ID and action type to identify specific access patterns
preconditions: User is logged in as Compliance Officer
User is on the Data Access Logs page with unfiltered logs displayed
Test data includes logs for user 'user12345' with multiple action types
Filter panel contains 'User ID' text input and 'Action Type' dropdown

steps.action: Enter 'user12345' in the 'User ID' text input field in the filter panel
steps.expectedResult: Text appears in the input field as typed, no auto-submit occurs

steps.action: Click on the 'Action Type' dropdown menu
steps.expectedResult: Dropdown expands showing options: 'All', 'READ', 'WRITE', 'DELETE', 'UPDATE' with 'All' currently selected

steps.action: Select 'READ' from the Action Type dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Dropdown closes, 'READ' is now displayed in the dropdown field

steps.action: Click the 'Apply Filters' button
steps.expectedResult: System retrieves and displays logs within 3 seconds showing only entries where User ID is 'user12345' AND Action Type is 'READ', result count updates to show number of matching entries

steps.action: Scroll through the filtered results and verify each entry
steps.expectedResult: All displayed log entries show User ID as 'user12345' and Action Type as 'READ', no entries with different user IDs or action types are visible

postconditions: Filtered results accurately reflect the combined filter criteria
Filter values remain in the filter panel for user reference
User can export or generate reports based on these filtered results
Original unfiltered data remains unchanged in the database

functional.title: Verify Compliance Officer can view complete audit trail details for a specific access log entry
preconditions: User is logged in as Compliance Officer
Data Access Logs page is displayed with at least 10 log entries visible
Each log entry has an 'View Details' or expand icon in the Actions column
Test log entry 'LOG-2024-001' exists with complete audit trail information

steps.action: Locate log entry 'LOG-2024-001' in the access logs table
steps.expectedResult: Log entry is visible in the table with basic information displayed in row format

steps.action: Click on the 'View Details' icon (eye icon) in the Actions column for log entry 'LOG-2024-001'
steps.expectedResult: Modal dialog or expandable panel opens displaying detailed audit trail information within 1 second

steps.action: Review the detailed audit trail information displayed
steps.expectedResult: Details panel shows: Full timestamp with milliseconds, User ID and User Name, Action Type with description, Resource Accessed with full path, IP Address and Geolocation, Browser/User Agent information, Session ID, Request Method, Response Status Code, Data Modified (if applicable), Previous Value and New Value (for UPDATE actions)

steps.action: Verify the completeness and accuracy of the audit trail data
steps.expectedResult: All fields contain valid data with no 'null' or 'undefined' values, timestamps are consistent, and data integrity checks pass (indicated by green checkmark or 'Verified' status)

steps.action: Click the 'Close' or 'X' button on the details panel
steps.expectedResult: Details panel closes smoothly, user returns to the main logs table view with the same scroll position maintained

postconditions: User has successfully viewed complete audit trail for the selected log entry
Audit trail viewing action itself is logged in the system
Details panel can be reopened for the same or different log entries
No data modifications occurred during the view operation

functional.title: Verify Compliance Officer receives alerts for suspicious access patterns detected in logs
preconditions: User is logged in as Compliance Officer
Alert system is configured with rules for suspicious patterns (e.g., multiple failed login attempts, access from unusual locations)
Test data includes log entries that trigger suspicious pattern alerts
User is on the Data Access Logs page
Notification panel or alert icon is visible in the top navigation bar

steps.action: Observe the notification icon (bell icon) in the top-right corner of the page
steps.expectedResult: Notification icon displays a red badge with number '3' indicating 3 unread alerts

steps.action: Click on the notification icon
steps.expectedResult: Notification dropdown panel opens displaying list of 3 alerts with titles: 'Multiple Failed Login Attempts Detected', 'Unusual Access Location', 'High Volume Data Export', each with timestamp and severity indicator (High/Medium/Low)

steps.action: Click on the first alert 'Multiple Failed Login Attempts Detected'
steps.expectedResult: Alert details expand showing: User ID 'user67890', 5 failed login attempts within 10 minutes, timestamps of attempts, IP address '192.168.1.100', recommended action 'Review and potentially lock account', and 'View Related Logs' button

steps.action: Click the 'View Related Logs' button within the alert details
steps.expectedResult: Notification panel closes, main logs table automatically filters to show only the 5 related log entries for user 'user67890' with failed login attempts, entries are highlighted in yellow for visibility

steps.action: Return to notifications and click 'Mark All as Read' button at the bottom of the notification panel
steps.expectedResult: All alerts are marked as read, red badge on notification icon disappears, alerts remain in notification history but are no longer highlighted as unread

postconditions: Compliance Officer has been successfully alerted to suspicious access patterns
Related logs are easily accessible from alert notifications
Alert acknowledgment is recorded in the system audit trail
Alerts remain in history for future reference and compliance reporting

functional.title: Verify Compliance Officer can generate and download compliance reports from access logs
preconditions: User is logged in as Compliance Officer
User is on the Data Access Logs page with filtered or unfiltered logs displayed
Report generation functionality is available via 'Generate Report' button
System has access to report generation service
At least 100 log entries exist for meaningful report generation

steps.action: Apply date range filter for the last 30 days using the filter panel
steps.expectedResult: Logs are filtered to show only entries from the last 30 days, result count displays number of matching entries

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button located in the top-right corner of the page
steps.expectedResult: Report configuration modal opens with options: Report Type (Summary/Detailed/Compliance Audit), Format (PDF/Excel/CSV), Include Charts (Yes/No), Date Range (pre-filled with current filter), and 'Generate' and 'Cancel' buttons

steps.action: Select 'Compliance Audit' as Report Type, 'PDF' as Format, and 'Yes' for Include Charts
steps.expectedResult: Selected options are highlighted, preview text shows 'Compliance Audit Report will include: Access summary, User activity breakdown, Suspicious activity alerts, Compliance metrics, Visual charts and graphs'

steps.action: Click the 'Generate' button in the modal
steps.expectedResult: Modal shows progress indicator 'Generating report... 0%', progress updates to 100% within 10 seconds, success message 'Report generated successfully' appears with 'Download' button

steps.action: Click the 'Download' button
steps.expectedResult: PDF file 'Compliance_Audit_Report_YYYY-MM-DD.pdf' downloads to default downloads folder, file size is appropriate (500KB-5MB), modal closes automatically

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF report
steps.expectedResult: Report opens successfully showing: Cover page with report title and date range, Table of contents, Executive summary, Detailed access logs table, User activity charts, Suspicious activity section, Compliance metrics (100% logging accuracy, average retrieval time), and footer with generation timestamp and Compliance Officer name

postconditions: Compliance report is successfully generated and downloaded
Report contains accurate data matching the filtered log entries
Report generation action is logged in the audit trail
Generated report is stored in system for 90 days for re-download if needed
User can generate additional reports with different parameters

negative.title: Verify system handles unauthorized access attempt to Data Access Logs page by non-Compliance Officer user
preconditions: User is logged in with 'Standard User' role without 'View Access Logs' permission
User is on the main dashboard
Access control is properly configured to restrict log viewing
Data Access Logs page URL is known: '/compliance/access-logs'

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to Data Access Logs by clicking on 'Data Access Logs' menu item (if visible) or by directly entering URL '/compliance/access-logs' in browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: System immediately redirects to 'Access Denied' page or displays error modal with message 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view access logs. Contact your administrator for access.', HTTP 403 Forbidden status is returned

steps.action: Verify the user's current location and available options
steps.expectedResult: User remains on dashboard or Access Denied page, Data Access Logs content is not displayed, no log data is visible in page source or network responses

steps.action: Check browser console and network tab for any data leakage
steps.expectedResult: No access log data is returned in API responses, console shows authorization error, no sensitive information is exposed in error messages

steps.action: Attempt to access the logs API endpoint directly using browser developer tools or API client with current session token
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden status with JSON response: {"error": "Insufficient permissions", "required_role": "Compliance Officer"}, no log data is returned

postconditions: Unauthorized access attempt is logged in security audit trail with user ID, timestamp, and attempted resource
User's session remains active but access to logs is denied
Security team is notified of unauthorized access attempt if configured
No data breach or information leakage occurred

negative.title: Verify system handles invalid date range filter inputs and displays appropriate error messages
preconditions: User is logged in as Compliance Officer
User is on the Data Access Logs page
Date range filter controls are visible and enabled
No filters are currently applied

steps.action: Click on 'Start Date' field and manually type invalid date '99/99/9999' instead of using calendar picker
steps.expectedResult: Field validation triggers immediately on blur, red border appears around the field, error message 'Invalid date format. Please use MM/DD/YYYY' displays below the field

steps.action: Clear the Start Date field and select a valid start date of '01/15/2024', then select an End Date of '01/10/2024' (before start date)
steps.expectedResult: When End Date is selected, validation error appears: 'End date must be after start date', End Date field shows red border, 'Apply Filters' button is disabled

steps.action: Correct the End Date to '01/20/2024' and then change Start Date to a future date '12/31/2025'
steps.expectedResult: Validation error displays: 'Start date cannot be in the future', Start Date field shows red border, 'Apply Filters' button remains disabled

steps.action: Set Start Date to '01/01/2020' and End Date to '12/31/2024' (date range exceeding 2 years if system has limit)
steps.expectedResult: Warning message appears: 'Date range exceeds maximum allowed period of 1 year. Please select a shorter range for optimal performance', 'Apply Filters' button shows warning icon but may remain enabled with confirmation

steps.action: Clear both date fields completely and click 'Apply Filters' button
steps.expectedResult: Validation error displays: 'Please select both start and end dates', both date fields show red borders, no API call is made, logs table remains unchanged

postconditions: No invalid filter queries are sent to the database
User is clearly informed of validation errors with specific guidance
System remains stable with no crashes or unexpected behavior
User can correct errors and successfully apply valid filters

negative.title: Verify system handles database connection failure during log retrieval gracefully
preconditions: User is logged in as Compliance Officer
User is on the Data Access Logs page
Test environment allows simulation of database connection failure
Database connection can be temporarily disabled for testing

steps.action: Simulate database connection failure (disconnect database or block database port)
steps.expectedResult: Database connection is unavailable for testing purposes

steps.action: Click 'Refresh' button or apply any filter to trigger log retrieval
steps.expectedResult: Loading spinner appears briefly, after timeout period (max 10 seconds), error message displays: 'Unable to retrieve access logs. Database connection failed. Please try again later or contact support if the issue persists.', error icon (red exclamation) is shown

steps.action: Verify the logs table state
steps.expectedResult: Logs table shows empty state with message 'No logs available due to connection error', no partial or stale data is displayed, previous data (if any) is cleared

steps.action: Check browser console for error details
steps.expectedResult: Console shows appropriate error logging without exposing sensitive database connection strings or credentials, error code and timestamp are logged for debugging

steps.action: Restore database connection and click 'Retry' button or refresh the page
steps.expectedResult: System successfully reconnects to database, logs are retrieved and displayed within 3 seconds, error message disappears, normal functionality is restored

postconditions: System gracefully handles database failure without crashing
User is informed of the issue with clear error messaging
No sensitive technical details are exposed to the user
Database connection failure is logged in system error logs for administrator review
System recovers automatically when connection is restored

negative.title: Verify system handles SQL injection attempts in User ID filter field
preconditions: User is logged in as Compliance Officer
User is on the Data Access Logs page
User ID filter field is available and accepts text input
System has SQL injection protection mechanisms in place

steps.action: Enter SQL injection payload "' OR '1'='1" in the User ID filter field
steps.expectedResult: Input is accepted in the field as plain text

steps.action: Click 'Apply Filters' button
steps.expectedResult: System treats the input as literal string search value, not as SQL code, either returns no results (if no user ID matches that exact string) or returns error 'Invalid User ID format', no database error occurs, no unauthorized data is returned

steps.action: Clear the field and enter another SQL injection payload "admin'--" in User ID field
steps.expectedResult: Input is sanitized or parameterized, query executes safely searching for literal string "admin'--", no SQL syntax error occurs, no comment-based SQL injection succeeds

steps.action: Enter payload "1; DROP TABLE access_logs;--" in User ID field and apply filter
steps.expectedResult: System safely handles the input, no database tables are dropped, query searches for the literal string, appropriate error or no results message is displayed, database integrity remains intact

steps.action: Check application logs and database logs for any SQL errors or injection attempts
steps.expectedResult: Security logs show the injection attempt was detected and blocked, alert is generated for security team, user's action is logged with details of attempted payload, database shows no structural changes or unauthorized queries

postconditions: SQL injection attempts are successfully prevented
Database integrity is maintained with no data loss or corruption
Security incident is logged for review
User account may be flagged for suspicious activity depending on security policy
System remains functional and secure

negative.title: Verify system handles session timeout during log viewing and report generation
preconditions: User is logged in as Compliance Officer
User is on the Data Access Logs page with logs displayed
Session timeout is set to 30 minutes of inactivity
User session can be expired for testing purposes

steps.action: Wait for session to expire (simulate by clearing session cookie or waiting for timeout period) while on the Data Access Logs page
steps.expectedResult: After session expires, page remains visible but session is invalid in backend

steps.action: Attempt to apply a filter or click 'Refresh' button to trigger an API call
steps.expectedResult: System detects expired session, displays modal overlay with message 'Your session has expired for security reasons. Please log in again to continue.', 'Log In' button is provided, all interactive elements are disabled

steps.action: Attempt to click 'Generate Report' button with expired session
steps.expectedResult: Same session expiration modal appears, report generation does not proceed, no API call is made with invalid session token

steps.action: Click 'Log In' button in the session expiration modal
steps.expectedResult: User is redirected to login page, current page URL is saved as return URL parameter, after successful login user is returned to Data Access Logs page

steps.action: Log in again with valid Compliance Officer credentials
steps.expectedResult: Login succeeds, user is redirected back to Data Access Logs page, new session is established, page loads fresh data, user can resume normal operations

postconditions: Expired session is handled gracefully without data loss
User is clearly informed of session expiration
User can easily re-authenticate and continue work
No unauthorized access occurs with expired session token
Session expiration event is logged in audit trail

negative.title: Verify system handles report generation failure due to insufficient system resources
preconditions: User is logged in as Compliance Officer
User is on the Data Access Logs page
Report generation service can be configured to fail or timeout
Large dataset of 100,000+ log entries exists for report generation

steps.action: Select date range covering 1 year with 100,000+ log entries
steps.expectedResult: Filter is applied, large number of results is indicated in result count

steps.action: Click 'Generate Report' button and select 'Detailed' report type with 'Excel' format including all charts
steps.expectedResult: Report configuration modal opens with selections made

steps.action: Click 'Generate' button to start report generation (simulate resource exhaustion or timeout in backend)
steps.expectedResult: Progress indicator starts showing 'Generating report... 15%', progress continues for a period

steps.action: Wait for report generation to fail due to timeout or resource limitation (after 60 seconds)
steps.expectedResult: Progress stops, error message displays: 'Report generation failed due to system resource limitations. Try reducing the date range or selecting Summary report type instead of Detailed.', 'Retry' and 'Close' buttons are provided, progress indicator shows red error state

steps.action: Click 'Close' button and reduce date range to 30 days, select 'Summary' report type
steps.expectedResult: Modal closes, user can adjust parameters, smaller report configuration is set

steps.action: Attempt report generation again with reduced parameters
steps.expectedResult: Report generates successfully within 10 seconds with smaller dataset, download completes successfully

postconditions: Report generation failure is handled gracefully with helpful error message
User is provided with actionable guidance to resolve the issue
System remains stable without crashes
Failed report generation attempt is logged for system monitoring
User can successfully generate report with adjusted parameters

edgeCases.title: Verify system handles retrieval and display of maximum allowed log entries (10,000 records) within performance requirements
preconditions: User is logged in as Compliance Officer
Database contains exactly 10,000 or more log entries for a specific date range
System has maximum result limit configured to 10,000 records
User is on the Data Access Logs page

steps.action: Apply date range filter that returns exactly 10,000 log entries
steps.expectedResult: System displays loading indicator

steps.action: Measure the time taken for log retrieval and initial page render
steps.expectedResult: Logs are retrieved and first page (25 entries) is displayed within 3 seconds, result count shows '10,000 results (maximum limit reached)', warning message displays: 'Maximum result limit of 10,000 records reached. Refine your filters for more specific results.'

steps.action: Navigate through pagination to the last page (page 400 if 25 entries per page)
steps.expectedResult: Pagination works smoothly, last page loads within 3 seconds, page shows remaining entries (25 entries on page 400), no performance degradation occurs

steps.action: Attempt to export all 10,000 records by clicking 'Export to CSV' button
steps.expectedResult: Export process starts with progress indicator, CSV file is generated within 30 seconds, file size is appropriate (5-15MB), file contains all 10,000 records with complete data

steps.action: Verify browser memory usage and system performance during large dataset handling
steps.expectedResult: Browser memory usage remains under 500MB, page remains responsive, no browser freezing or crashes occur, scrolling and interactions remain smooth

postconditions: System successfully handles maximum record limit without performance issues
User is informed when result limit is reached
All 10,000 records are accessible through pagination
Export functionality works correctly with large datasets
System performance remains within acceptable parameters

User is on the Data Access Logs page
Database contains log entries but none matching specific filter criteria
Filter for non-existent user ID 'NONEXISTENT_USER_999' is available

steps.expectedResult: Text is entered in the field

steps.action: Click 'Apply Filters' button
steps.expectedResult: Loading indicator appears briefly, system completes query within 3 seconds

steps.expectedResult: Empty state is displayed with icon (empty folder or magnifying glass), message reads: 'No access logs found matching your filter criteria', sub-message: 'Try adjusting your filters or clearing them to see all logs', 'Clear Filters' button is prominently displayed, result count shows '0 results'

steps.action: Verify that pagination controls are hidden or disabled
steps.expectedResult: Pagination controls are not displayed or are disabled/grayed out, no page numbers are shown

No errors or broken UI elements appear

System performance is not impacted by empty results

steps.action: Locate and observe the log entry with User ID containing HTML/script tags 'test<script>alert(1)</script>'

Text rendering is correct across all character sets
Long text values are displayed properly without breaking UI layout
Filtering and reporting work correctly with special characters
Data integrity is maintained for all character types

preconditions: Three Compliance Officer users are logged in from different browsers/sessions: User A, User B, User C
All users are on the Data Access Logs page
Database contains sufficient log entries for testing
System supports concurrent user sessions

steps.action: User A applies date range filter for last 7 days
steps.expectedResult: User A sees filtered results for last 7 days within 3 seconds

steps.action: Simultaneously, User B applies filter for User ID 'user123' and User C applies filter for Action Type 'DELETE'
steps.expectedResult: Each user sees their own filtered results independently within 3 seconds, no cross-contamination of filter results occurs, each session maintains separate filter state

steps.action: User A starts generating a Compliance Audit report while User B and User C continue browsing logs

steps.action: User B generates a report while User A and User C are viewing log details
steps.expectedResult: Report generation completes successfully for User B, User A and User C experience no interruption or performance degradation, system resources are properly managed across concurrent operations

Each user's session and filters remain independent and isolated
Performance remains within acceptable limits (3 seconds) for all users
No data corruption or session conflicts occur
Database connection pooling handles concurrent queries efficiently

User is on the Data Access Logs page

steps.action: Click 'Refresh' button to reload logs and measure load time using browser performance tools
steps.expectedResult: Logs load within 3 seconds even under throttled network conditions, performance metric shows load time between 2.5-3.0 seconds, page remains functional, loading indicator displays during retrieval

steps.action: Apply a complex filter (date range + user ID + action type) and measure retrieval time
steps.expectedResult: Filtered results are returned within 3 seconds, system optimizes query to meet performance requirement, result count and data display correctly

steps.expectedResult: With normal network, logs load within 3 seconds consistently, system performance returns to expected levels

postconditions: System meets 3-second performance requirement under normal and fast network conditions
Graceful degradation occurs under extremely slow network conditions
User is informed of performance issues related to network conditions
System remains functional across various network speeds
Performance metrics are logged for monitoring and optimization

accessibility.title: Verify complete keyboard navigation through Data Access Logs page including filters, table, and pagination

Keyboard is the only input method being used (mouse disconnected or not used)

steps.action: Navigate to the 'Start Date' calendar field using Tab and press Enter or Space to open calendar picker
steps.expectedResult: Calendar picker opens, focus moves to current date, arrow keys (Up/Down/Left/Right) navigate between dates, Enter selects date, Escape closes calendar without selection, selected date is announced by screen reader

steps.action: Tab to 'Action Type' dropdown and press Enter or Space to open dropdown menu
steps.expectedResult: Dropdown menu opens, focus moves to currently selected option, Up/Down arrow keys navigate through options ('All', 'READ', 'WRITE', 'DELETE', 'UPDATE'), Enter selects option, Escape closes dropdown, selected option is announced

steps.action: Tab to 'Apply Filters' button and press Enter
steps.expectedResult: Filters are applied, focus remains on button or moves to results area, loading state is announced to screen readers, filtered results load and result count is announced

steps.action: Tab into the logs table and navigate through rows using Tab key
steps.expectedResult: Focus moves to first interactive element in table (View Details button in first row), Tab continues through each row's action buttons, table navigation is logical and predictable

steps.action: Press Enter on a 'View Details' button while focused
steps.expectedResult: Details modal opens, focus automatically moves to modal content (first focusable element or close button), Tab key cycles through modal elements only (focus is trapped in modal), Escape key closes modal and returns focus to the 'View Details' button that opened it

steps.action: Navigate to pagination controls using Tab and use Enter to activate 'Next Page' button
steps.expectedResult: Next page loads, focus moves to first log entry or result count announcement, page change is announced to screen readers: 'Page 2 of 10 loaded', keyboard navigation continues to work on new page

postconditions: All interactive elements are accessible via keyboard without requiring mouse
Focus order is logical and follows visual layout
Focus indicators are clearly visible on all elements
Focus management works correctly for modals and dynamic content
User can complete all tasks using keyboard only

accessibility.title: Verify screen reader compatibility and proper ARIA labels for all page elements and interactions
preconditions: User is logged in as Compliance Officer
Screen reader is active (NVDA, JAWS, or VoiceOver)
User is on the Data Access Logs page

performance.title: Concurrent User Load Testing for Access Log Retrieval with Filters
performance.description: Validate system performance when multiple compliance officers simultaneously retrieve and filter access logs under normal and peak load conditions. Ensure log retrieval meets the 3-second SLA requirement and system maintains stability with acceptable resource utilization.
preconditions: Access logs database populated with minimum 1 million log entries spanning 90 days

steps.action: Execute 15-minute load test with users performing log retrieval operations every 30 seconds with random filter combinations
steps.expectedResult: P95 response time ≤ 3 seconds, P99 response time ≤ 4 seconds, 0% error rate, throughput ≥ 100 requests/second

steps.action: Increase load to 200 concurrent users (peak load) and execute for 20 minutes with same user behavior pattern
steps.expectedResult: P95 response time ≤ 3 seconds, P99 response time ≤ 5 seconds, error rate < 0.1%, throughput ≥ 350 requests/second

steps.action: Monitor and record CPU utilization, memory consumption, database connection pool usage, and network I/O throughout test execution
steps.expectedResult: CPU utilization < 75%, memory usage < 80%, database connections < 85% of pool limit, no connection timeouts

steps.action: Analyze response time distribution, identify bottlenecks, and validate log retrieval accuracy by sampling 100 random responses
steps.expectedResult: All sampled log entries are complete and accurate, no data corruption, response time degradation < 20% from baseline

postconditions: System returns to idle state within 2 minutes after test completion
No memory leaks detected
All database connections properly released
Application logs contain no errors or exceptions
Test results documented with performance metrics dashboard
performance.testData: 1 million access log entries with varied attributes: timestamps (last 90 days), user IDs (500 unique users), resource types (10 categories), access types (read/write/delete), IP addresses, session IDs, compliance flags
toolsRequired: Application Performance Monitoring (APM) tool - New Relic/Dynatrace

Customizations persist across sessions

Recommendations: Implement keyboard shortcut legend (accessible via '?' key), add bulk operations for common compliance tasks, provide customizable dashboard widgets, enable filter template sharing across compliance team, add 'Recent Actions' quick access menu, implement column presets for different compliance frameworks (GDPR, SOC2, HIPAA)
usability.testData: Large dataset with 50,000+ log entries, multiple user types, various action types, and diverse resources accessed

reliability.title: Access Log Database Failure and Recovery Validation with Zero Data Loss
reliability.description: Validate that access log data integrity is maintained during database failure scenarios and that the system recovers within RTO/RPO compliance requirements. This test ensures 100% of access events are logged correctly even during database unavailability, with automatic recovery and no data loss.
preconditions: Access logs database is operational and connected
Monitoring system is actively logging access events
Database replication/backup mechanisms are configured
Baseline steady state: 100% log capture rate, <3s retrieval time
Test environment mirrors production database configuration

steps.action: Establish baseline steady state by generating 1000 access events per minute and verify 100% are logged with retrieval time <3 seconds
steps.expectedResult: All 1000 events/min are captured in logs, retrieval time averages 1-2 seconds, system shows healthy state

steps.action: Inject database failure by stopping the primary database instance while continuing to generate access events at normal rate
steps.expectedResult: System detects database failure within 5 seconds, activates buffering/queuing mechanism, no access events are lost

steps.action: Continue generating access events for 5 minutes during database outage and monitor buffer/queue status
steps.expectedResult: All access events are queued in memory/message queue, system displays degraded state warning, no data loss occurs, buffer does not overflow

steps.action: Restore database availability and monitor automatic recovery process
steps.expectedResult: System detects database availability within 10 seconds, begins flushing queued events to database, MTTR <2 minutes

steps.action: Verify data integrity by counting all logged events during failure period and validate RPO=0 (zero data loss)
steps.expectedResult: 100% of access events generated during outage are present in database, no duplicates, timestamps are accurate, RPO compliance achieved

steps.action: Validate system returns to steady state with normal log retrieval performance <3 seconds
steps.expectedResult: Log retrieval time returns to <3 seconds, all monitoring dashboards show healthy state, no residual errors

postconditions: Database is fully operational
All queued events are persisted to database
System monitoring shows healthy state
No data loss occurred (RPO=0 validated)
Recovery time documented for MTTR calculation
reliability.testData: Generate synthetic access events with unique identifiers: user_id, timestamp, resource_accessed, action_type, IP_address. Use event generator producing 1000 events/min with sequential IDs for tracking.
toolsRequired: Chaos engineering platform (Gremlin, Chaos Monkey, or LitmusChaos)

reliability.title: Network Partition Chaos Experiment - Log Service Isolation and Alert System Resilience
reliability.description: Execute hypothesis-driven chaos experiment to validate that suspicious access pattern alerts continue functioning during network partition between log collection service and alert processing service. Tests system resilience to network failures and validates alert delivery SLO of 99.9% availability.
preconditions: Access log monitoring system is operational across multiple services
Alert system for suspicious patterns is configured and tested
Network chaos tools are deployed and tested
Baseline: Alert detection latency <30 seconds, 100% alert delivery
Distributed tracing enabled for observability

steps.action: Define hypothesis: 'When network partition occurs between log collector and alert processor, alerts will still be delivered within 2 minutes via alternative path or queuing, maintaining >99% delivery rate'
steps.expectedResult: Hypothesis documented with success criteria: alert delivery >99%, latency <2min, no permanent alert loss

steps.action: Establish steady state by generating normal access patterns plus 10 suspicious access patterns per minute, verify all alerts are triggered within 30 seconds
steps.expectedResult: 100% of suspicious patterns generate alerts within 30 seconds, compliance officer receives all notifications

steps.action: Inject network partition using chaos tool to isolate log collector from alert processor for 10 minutes, limit blast radius to test environment only
steps.expectedResult: Network partition confirmed via monitoring, services cannot communicate directly, partition isolated to test environment

steps.action: Continue generating suspicious access patterns during partition and monitor alert queuing/alternative routing mechanisms
steps.expectedResult: Alerts are queued in message broker or routed via backup network path, no alerts are dropped, system shows degraded connectivity warning

steps.action: Remove network partition and observe alert delivery recovery and queue processing
steps.expectedResult: Network connectivity restored within 30 seconds, queued alerts are delivered within 2 minutes, MTTR for alert system <2.5 minutes

steps.action: Validate hypothesis by counting delivered alerts: verify >99% delivery rate and all critical suspicious patterns were reported
steps.expectedResult: Hypothesis validated: ≥99% alert delivery achieved, maximum alert delay <2 minutes, zero permanent alert loss, availability SLO maintained

postconditions: Network partition removed completely
All services return to normal communication
Alert queue is cleared
Chaos experiment results documented
Hypothesis outcome recorded (validated/invalidated)
reliability.testData: Suspicious pattern test data: 10 failed login attempts from same IP, access to 50+ records in <1 minute, access outside business hours, privilege escalation attempts. Normal patterns: 100 legitimate access events/min.
toolsRequired: Network chaos tool (Pumba, Toxiproxy, or Chaos Mesh)

reliability.title: External Compliance Reporting API Failure with Circuit Breaker Validation
reliability.description: Validate circuit breaker pattern implementation when external compliance reporting API becomes unavailable or degraded. Ensures compliance officers can still access logs and generate reports locally while external API is down, with proper circuit breaker state transitions (Closed->Open->Half-Open->Closed).
preconditions: External compliance reporting API integration is active
Circuit breaker is configured with thresholds: 5 failures in 10s triggers open, 30s timeout, 3 success attempts to close
Local report generation fallback mechanism is implemented
Baseline: API response time <2 seconds, 99.5% success rate
Circuit breaker monitoring dashboard is available

steps.action: Establish steady state by generating 5 compliance reports using external API, verify all succeed within 2 seconds
steps.expectedResult: All 5 reports generated successfully via external API, circuit breaker in CLOSED state, response time <2 seconds

steps.action: Inject failure into external API by configuring it to return 500 errors or timeout after 10 seconds
steps.expectedResult: External API becomes unavailable, returns errors or timeouts consistently

steps.action: Attempt to generate 5 compliance reports and monitor circuit breaker state transition to OPEN after threshold reached
steps.expectedResult: After 5 consecutive failures within 10 seconds, circuit breaker transitions to OPEN state, subsequent requests fail fast without calling API (<100ms response)

steps.action: Verify fallback mechanism activates and compliance officer can generate reports using local data with degraded functionality warning
steps.expectedResult: System automatically switches to local report generation, reports are created from cached log data, user sees notification about limited external compliance validation

steps.action: Wait 30 seconds for circuit breaker timeout, then restore external API to healthy state
steps.expectedResult: Circuit breaker transitions to HALF-OPEN state after 30s timeout, external API is operational and responding normally

steps.action: Generate 3 test reports to validate circuit breaker transitions to CLOSED state after successful attempts
steps.expectedResult: First 3 report requests succeed via external API, circuit breaker transitions to CLOSED state, full functionality restored, MTTR <2 minutes

steps.action: Validate retry policy with exponential backoff by monitoring retry attempts during recovery phase
steps.expectedResult: Retry attempts follow exponential backoff pattern: 1s, 2s, 4s intervals, maximum 3 retries before circuit opens, no retry storms observed

postconditions: External API is fully restored
Circuit breaker is in CLOSED state
All report generation functions normally
Fallback mechanism is deactivated
Circuit breaker metrics logged for analysis
reliability.testData: Compliance report requests: date range filters (last 30 days), user access patterns, failed access attempts, privilege changes. Test with 3 different report types: audit summary, detailed access log, suspicious activity report.
toolsRequired: Circuit breaker monitoring (Hystrix Dashboard, Resilience4j metrics)
Load testing tool for request generation

userStoryObject.title: As Compliance Officer, I want to monitor data access logs to achieve regulatory compliance
userStoryObject.description:
CONTEXT & BACKGROUND:

Monitoring data access logs is essential for maintaining compliance with data protection regulations.

CURRENT STATE:

Lack of monitoring leads to difficulties in auditing and compliance verification.

DESIRED STATE:

Comprehensive logging and monitoring will facilitate compliance audits and improve data security.

KEY FUNCTIONALITY:

  • Access log viewing capabilities
  • Audit trail for data access
  • Alerts for suspicious access patterns
  • Reporting tools for compliance verification
  • User
-friendly interface for log management

USER INTERACTION FLOW:

  1. User navigates to the data access logs page.
  2. User applies filters to view specific access logs.
  3. System retrieves and displays logs.
  4. User analyzes logs for compliance checks.
  5. User generates compliance reports as needed.


TECHNICAL CONSIDERATIONS:

  • Data source: Access logs database
  • Validation rules: Log integrity checks
  • Security: Access controls for viewing logs
  • Performance: Log retrieval under
3 seconds.

OUT OF SCOPE:

  • Detailed content of API requests and responses.


SUCCESS METRICS:

  • 100% of access events are logged correctly.
  • Log retrieval completed within 3 seconds.

Persona: Compliance Officer (Compliance Officer)
userStoryObject.acceptanceCriteria:
Criteria 1: Users can view access logs without errors.

Criteria 2: Log retrieval happens within 3 seconds.

Criteria 3: Audit trails are complete and accurate for compliance checks.
